figure_2.caption: Methodological quality graph: review authors' judgements about each methodological quality item presented as percentages across all included studies.

figure_3.caption: Risk of bias summary: review authors' judgements about each risk of bias item for each included study.

claims.sentence: Update searches run in May 2020 identified a further 1120 records (Figure 1).

In INTREPID 2013 and MERLOT 2016 the primary outcome was the number of pro re nata (PRN) ranibizumab injections administered over 52 weeks.Excluded studies
See 'Characteristics of excluded studies' table.Risk of bias in included studies
Figure 2 and Figure 3 summarise the assessment of the risk of bias in included studies.
We also noted an asymmetric funnel plot (Figure 4) possibly indicative of publication bias.
Page 569, figure 1.

Blinding of outcome assessment (detection bias) Lesion size on fluorescein angiography
Low risk
Quote: "Assessment of outcomes, including visual acuity, angiographic interpretation, and assessment of complications and adverse events, was performed in a masked fashion." Page 618


Incomplete outcome data (attrition bias) All outcomes
Unclear risk
Quote: "The overall complete follow‐up rate was 84.1% (85/101) (Table 1 and Figure 1). there was no significant difference between the two groups; the complete follow‐up rate was 88.2% (45/51) and 80.0% (40/50) in the treatment group and control group, respectively.
Page 2241, figure 1.
